services.name: AI Storyboard Generator
services.overview: The AI Storyboard Generator is a SaaS platform designed to streamline and accelerate the storyboard creation process for film, television, and video production. By leveraging Natural Language Processing (NLP) and generative AI, the platform transforms script outlines and screenplays into detailed storyboards with AI-generated visuals. This significantly reduces the time and cost associated with traditional storyboard creation, empowering directors, storyboard artists, and production designers to visualize their projects more effectively and efficiently.
problems_addressed: High cost and time investment in traditional storyboard creation.
Difficulty in quickly visualizing script narratives and camera angles.
Communication gaps between directors, writers, and visual artists during pre-production.
core_features: Script Upload and Analysis: Users can upload script outlines or full screenplays in standard formats (e.g., .pdf, .docx, .fdx). The system uses NLP to parse the script, identify key scenes, actions, and dialogue, and extract relevant information for storyboard generation.

AI-Powered Panel Generation: Based on the script analysis, the system automatically generates storyboard panels with AI-generated visuals. This includes scene compositions, character poses, camera angles (e.g., wide shot, close-up, over-the-shoulder), and background elements.

Customizable Visual Style: Users can select a desired visual style for the storyboard panels, such as photorealistic, illustrated, comic book, or anime. The AI model adapts its output to match the chosen style, ensuring consistency and artistic direction.

Panel Editing and Refinement: Users can edit and refine the AI-generated panels using a built-in editor. This includes adjusting camera angles, character poses, adding dialogue balloons, annotations, and importing custom assets (e.g., character designs, location sketches).

Collaboration and Feedback: The platform supports real-time collaboration, allowing multiple users to view, comment on, and edit the storyboard. Directors can provide feedback to storyboard artists and production designers directly within the platform, streamlining the review and approval process.
Storyboard Export: Export the completed storyboard in various formats (PDF, image sequences, animatic video) for sharing with the production team.
user_journeys: A film director uploads a screenplay to the platform. The AI analyzes the script and generates a draft storyboard with suggested panels, camera angles, and character poses. The director reviews the storyboard, makes adjustments to specific panels, adds annotations for the production designer, and shares the storyboard with the cinematographer for further input. The final storyboard is then exported as a PDF and an animatic video to be used in pre-production meetings.
ai_capabilities: NLP for script analysis and scene understanding: Uses transformer-based models (e.g., BERT, RoBERTa) fine-tuned on film scripts to extract key information, including character actions, dialogue, and scene settings.

Generative AI for visual creation: Employs diffusion models (e.g., Stable Diffusion, DALL-E 3) fine-tuned on a dataset of storyboard panels, film stills, and character designs to generate realistic and stylized visuals.
Camera angle and composition suggestion: Utilizes a classification model trained on film theory principles to suggest appropriate camera angles and compositions based on the scene context.
Pose estimation and character animation: Employs pose estimation models (e.g., OpenPose) to suggest character poses and create simple animations for animatics.

data_schema_recommendations: Database schema for storing script data: {script_id, title, author, scenes: [{scene_id, scene_number, description, actions: [{character, action_description}]}]}
Database schema for storing storyboard data: {storyboard_id, script_id, panels: [{panel_id, scene_id, image_url, camera_angle, character_poses, dialogue, annotations}]}
Object storage for storing images: (panel images, custom assets)
data_sources: User input through the platform's interface
Potential integration with scriptwriting software (e.g., Final Draft)
data_requirements.privacy_and_compliance: Ensure compliance with copyright laws regarding the use of publicly available film stills and character designs in the AI model's training data. Implement user data encryption and adhere to GDPR and CCPA regulations.

required_integrations: Cloud storage services (e.g., Google Drive, Dropbox) for script uploading
Collaboration platforms (e.g., Slack, Microsoft Teams) for notifications and feedback sharing
Payment gateway (Stripe, PayPal) for subscription management
integration_plan.authentication_strategy: JWT (JSON Web Tokens) for secure API authentication. Consider Clerk or Auth0 for user authentication and management, enabling features like social login and multi-factor authentication.

technical_specifications.architecture: The platform will follow a microservices architecture, comprising an API layer, a frontend application, a backend service, a database, and an AI pipeline. The API layer will handle requests from the frontend and orchestrate interactions between the backend and AI services. The frontend will provide the user interface for script uploading, storyboard editing, and collaboration. The backend will manage user authentication, data storage, and job queuing. The AI pipeline will perform script analysis, panel generation, and visual style customization.

recommended_tech_stack.frontend: Next.js 14 App Router, TailwindCSS, shadcn/ui, Vercel conventions
recommended_tech_stack.backend: Node.js / Next.js server actions / Vercel serverless functions
recommended_tech_stack.database: Planetscale / Supabase / PostgreSQL with schema notes: script data, storyboard panel metadata, user accounts, roles, permissions
recommended_tech_stack.storage: Supabase storage / AWS S3 / Vercel Blob: panel images, uploaded assets
recommended_tech_stack.AI: OpenAI API (DALL-E 3 for image generation, GPT-4 for script analysis), embeddings, vector DB (Pinecone/Supabase vectors) for storing visual style preferences
recommended_tech_stack.APIs: REST API for communication between frontend and backend services

API_design: POST /api/scripts: Upload a script file and initiate script analysis.
GET /api/scripts/{script_id}: Retrieve script details and associated storyboards.
POST /api/storyboards/{script_id}: Generate a new storyboard for a given script.
GET /api/storyboards/{storyboard_id}: Retrieve storyboard details and panels.
PUT /api/storyboards/{storyboard_id}/panels/{panel_id}: Update a specific storyboard panel.
frontend_components: Script Uploader: A component for uploading script files and displaying upload progress.
Storyboard Editor: An interactive editor for viewing, editing, and rearranging storyboard panels.
Panel Editor: A component for editing individual storyboard panels, including camera angles, character poses, dialogue, and annotations.
Visual Style Selector: A component for selecting the desired visual style for the storyboard panels.
Collaboration Dashboard: A dashboard for managing collaborators and viewing feedback.

deployment_instructions: Environment variables: OPENAI_API_KEY, DATABASE_URL, SUPABASE_URL, SUPABASE_ANON_KEY, CLERK_SECRET_KEY (if using Clerk)
Vercel deployment: Connect GitHub repository to Vercel, configure environment variables, enable automatic deployments on push.
Build outputs: Next.js static export, serverless functions
Runtime settings: Node.js runtime version, memory limits for serverless functions

pricing_strategy: SaaS subscription tiers: Free (limited features, watermarked output), Basic, Pro, Enterprise (custom pricing).
Usage-based pricing: Charge per storyboard generated or per panel generated, with tiered pricing based on volume.
Add-ons: Offer optional add-ons, such as access to premium visual styles or dedicated support.

success_metrics: Operational KPIs: Number of active users, script uploads per day, storyboards generated per day, average time spent on the platform.
AI performance KPIs: Accuracy of script analysis (measured by the relevance of generated panels to the script), user satisfaction with AI-generated visuals (measured by feedback scores).
Adoption/engagement KPIs: User retention rate, conversion rate from free to paid subscriptions, number of collaborative projects created on the platform.
